data.name: Morty-3000 Interpreter
data.description:
`Rick`: Hey Morty! We are in CODE!!

`Morty`: W-what? What code?

`Rick`: JS-code, Morty. Millions of sites in the whole multiverse are uses Javascript code. It makes sites more interactive!

`Morty`: But h-how did we get here?

`Rick`: It doesn't matter now, Morty. We need to get out of here. I heard a huge amount of bugs dwells here, and they are dangerous, some of them are very dangerous. So they can turn beautiful and fast site into slow monsters.

`Morty`: WHAT? RICK, I-I DON'T WANNA DIE HERE! AAAAA!

`Rick`: Calm down, Morty. I have a teleport gun.

*(One of bugs eats a teleport gun)*

`Rick`: AAAAAAAAAA! RUN, MORTY!!

# Task

Your task is to help Rick and Morty to get out of JS-code. Rick is very clever and he has invented his own esoteric language to send message to other Ricks and ask for help. He loves his grandson Morty and called language *"Morty-3000"*. This language has potentially infinite array of bytes, initialized to 0 and this syntax:

- `hey` moves pointer to right cell
- `morty` moves pointer to left cell
- `wubba` starts a loop, if the byte of data pointer is `0`, skip code before matching `lubba`
- `lubba` ends a loop, if a byte of data pointer is not `0`, jump to matching `wubba`
- `dub` increments the data pointer, handling overflow (255 + 1 = 0)
- `lets` decrements the data pointer (0 - 1 = 255)
- `get` gets ASCII code of character from input stream and stores it at the data pointer
- `out` adds a character with code equals the data pointer to `output`

# Input

Function `translateItMorty` takes in 2 arguments:

- `code` - the string with the sequence of commands
- `input`*(optional)* - input stream

# Output

Function `translateItMorty` should return an `output`*(string)*.
